articles.title: About
articles.description: A personal website for Eli Pousson.
articles.contents:
Hello! My name is Eli Pousson. I am a planner and program coordinator with the Neighborhood Design Center, a Fellow with the Johns Hopkins University School of Public Health Bloomberg American Health Initiative, and local historian in Baltimore, Maryland.
I’m currently working a few R packages for mapping and analyzing data related to Baltimore City:
mapbaltimore
bcpss
baltimoredata
I recently completed Master’s of Public Health degree at Johns Hopkins University. My work during the program included completed an analysis of 311 requests for basement sewage backups in Baltimore and advocacy for the creation of Baltimore’s Slow Streets program in early 2020.
Here are a few projects from my prior work at Baltimore Heritage:
Explore Baltimore Heritage
Baltimore’s Civil Rights Landmarks
